Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 0.198 nm (average pore size), 0.69 nm (d-spacing of P+GO sheets)

Other Information.Test Conditions: 250 ppm, 400 ppm, 1000 ppm, and 2000 ppm synthetic water formulation, 0.69 MPa
Other Information.Additional Info: Sodium ions are rejected due to size exclusion in the CuMOF pores.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 250 ppm, 400 ppm, 1000 ppm, and 2000 ppm synthetic water formulation, 0.69 MPa
Other Information.Additional Info: Calcium ions are rejected due to size exclusion in the CuMOF pores.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 250 ppm, 400 ppm, 1000 ppm, and 2000 ppm synthetic water formulation, 0.69 MPa
Other Information.Additional Info: Magnesium ions are rejected due to size exclusion in the CuMOF pores.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 250 ppm, 400 ppm, 1000 ppm, and 2000 ppm synthetic water formulation, 0.69 MPa
Other Information.Additional Info: Water molecules pass through the d-spacing of P+GO sheets (0.69 nm).

Experimental Validation.Method: Synthetic water rejection experiments using ICP-MS for feed and permeate concentration analysis
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Salt rejection: 99.9% at 250 ppm, 98.6% at 400 ppm, 97.9% at 1000 ppm, and 96.8% at 2000 ppm

Other Information.Additional Info: The P+GO anchored CuMOF interlayer prevents swelling of GO sheets and enhances ion rejection efficiency.
